description: ALC India launched Transforming India Initiative, under a unique 8-year social enterprise development support program. The flagship program focuses on creating social entrepreneurs and providing them with complete lifecycle support, from pre-incubation to incubation to acceleration.

Is selected by Niti Aayog as one of the six enterprises to receive grant support to establish and incubate enterprises. 5 community-owned enterprises promoted by ALC India do a combined business of Rs. 20 crores.
ALC India partners with an internally displaced community in Odisha and leprosy-affected in Tamil Nadu to incubate and promote producer organisations, the first of its kind in the country.

Partners with Tata Power to establish a dairy collective enterprises in Maval, Pune with an estimated impact of 3000 households. Initiates Employment Generation Program â€“ a domain focused on skill development.
Access Livelihoods Development Finance is set up with the aim to raise much-needed capital by enterprises during the incubation period.
ALC India partners Kutch Nav Nirman Abhiyaan (KNNA) established six Producer Companies of 3000 small livestock holders in the Kutch region of Gujarat.
12000 households were beneficiaries of ALC India's direct outreach program from 2005. An estimated 1.5 million were indirectly benefitted.
